p: Pressurized hot water extraction (PHWE), a process which combines pressure and high water temperature, is a green extraction method for foods and herbal plants ( Chemat et al., 2012). The advantage of PHWE is that the degradation of minor components is minimized because of the short extraction time ( dos Santos Freitas et al., 2008). More importantly, PHWE utilizes hot water, whereas traditional extraction methods, such as pressurized liquid extraction requires non-environmentally friendly organic solvents ( Kronholm et al., 2007). Studies on the quality properties of vegetables and fruit oil prepared by PHWE have been published ( Mustafa and Turner, 2011). PHWE-employed fat extraction from animal skin has not been frequently used but its advantages to protect minor components in the fats and protect the environment warrant further investigation.
